medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 week prior to presentation with fatigue and malaise. On the evening before presentation, the patient experienced worsening substernal chest pressure that prevented sleep, leading to consultation the following morning.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prior acute coronary syndrome managed with percutaneous coronary intervention, diffuse cutaneous systemic sclerosis, mononeuritis multiplex, thrombocytopenia, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, hypothyroidism, and gastroesophageal reflux disease.
medical_history.family_history: Mother suffered a myocardial infarction in her 50s and later died of heart failure; father died at a young age in a motor vehicle accident.
medical_history.social_history: Married; works as a nurse educator; rarely consumes alcohol; never used tobacco products or illicit substances.
